GapFillInput.Title: Past perfect
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type the verbs in brackets into the Past simple or Past perfect.

Content.Question: Can you believe it?1. A Venezuelan man made (make) an expensive mistake when he threw away a black plastic bag; his wife had hidden|'d hidden (hide) all her jewellery in it. When she found out what had happened|'d happened (happen), she phoned (phone) the rubbish company. The people there explained (explain) that they had burned|had burnt|'d burned|'d burnt (burn) all that day's rubbish a few hours before. 2. A man walked (walk) into a bank and asked for £100,000. After the cashier had given|'d given|gave (give) him the money he ran (run) away. Unfortunately for him, he didn't realise he had left|'d left (leave) his driving license in the bank with this name and address in it. 3. Last week a seventy-year-old German woman won (win) €200 in a children's art competition by entering a picture she had painted|'d painted (paint) sixty years earlier.
